title: Marketing: Career Cluster Knowledge and Skill Statements with Suggested Performance Indicators
subject: CTE

document.title: BUSINESS AND MANAGEMENT Statewide Program of Study Framework: Marketing Career Cluster

3BB7EB3118BC4322943E5F871BDDBEB8.description:
Plan and participate in mock-up client presentations (includes strategies and
research findings)

AAA312C63BAC4BFABE2D52A71EA0B58E.description:
Write contact reports, white papers, pitch/sales letters, new business pitches,
and marketing emails

7F164D4BB9134A99994AAD26605592CA.description: Prepare day-to-day content for social platforms

3EFF05C1572846A6898ED1F78472A11A.description:
Demonstrate the ability to communicate verbally (including on the phone), in
writing, and using electronic communication tools in the context of marketing

D99D64ABBC794B0BAE0EE1F18483870C.description:
Apply verbal and internal
and external business
correspondence skills to obtain
and convey information

DA5EC1838A724504ACBB8EC1547A0FE9.description:
Demonstrate understanding of sales processes and techniques to enhance
customer relationships and to increase the likelihood of making sales
(e.g., explain the selling process, discuss motivational theories that impact
buying behavior)

0F4D9858858F4FDDA4004BB56E28744E.description:
Analyze product knowledge to identify and communicate product features and
benefits and to ensure appropriateness of product for the customer

10EEEF7BF0994104B0DBCCBBAF570487.description:
Acquire a foundational knowledge of selling to understand its nature and scope
(e.g., explain the nature and scope of the selling function, the role of customer
service as a component of selling relationships, company selling policies, key
factors in building a clientele, legal and ethical considerations in selling, the use
of technology in the selling function)

8151F4877DB5466FBB56C8D930D74100.description:
Demonstrate understanding
of the concepts and actions
needed to determine client
needs and wants and
respond through planned,
personalized communication
that influences purchase
decisions and enhances future
business opportunities

F60DA0608D864A1FA43391D3C1EE9B37.description:
Demonstrate understanding of the use of public-relations activities to
communicate with targeted audiences (e.g., identify types of public-relations
activities, discuss internal and external audiences for public relations activities)

E4DD8B9F40B04D1C81EC94A681E62DCD.description:
Explain the components of advertisements and the importance of coordinating
elements in advertisements

3E4748B51FD94418AC0C4A5E93368F67.description:
Explain promotional channels used to communicate with targeted audiences
(e.g., types of advertising media, word-of-mouth channels used to communicate
with targeted audiences, direct marketing channels, communications
channels used in sales promotion, communications channels used in public-relations activities)

010746C7FAAA48A4B19F73BA08645780.description:
Acquire a foundational knowledge of promotion to understand its nature and
scope (e.g., explain the role of promotion as a marketing function, explain the
types of promotion, identify the elements of the promotional mix, describe
the use of business ethics in promotion, describe the use of technology in the
promotion function, describe the regulation of promotion)

8CA04FAC96C04C779B58457CC832FE7F.description:
Demonstrate understanding
of the concepts and strategies
needed to communicate
information about products,
services, images, and/or ideas
to achieve a desired outcome

AA7B2137A92F454B857C53614DEFCD95.description: Explain the use of technology in the pricing function

9AC87442C5B247BB903CDA336E34635C.description: Describe the role of business ethics in pricing

FA15C46E93E04125BB1311B87531B466.description: Explain the nature and scope of the pricing function

F1860B25F9514AB98A19A701FBC86163.description:
Demonstrate understanding
of concepts and strategies
utilized in determining and
adjusting prices to maximize
return and meet customers’
perceptions of value

C47ABF9E5DBD48799A3DB565EA4BB61D.description:
Employ marketing-information to plan marketing activities (e.g., explain the
nature of marketing planning and plans and sales forecasts, explain the role of
situation analysis)

16EAB923E3724AB3A5BE6AA0E16937A7.description: Explain the concept of market and market identification

8AB719E3B45844ECA678A6F239E807A0.description: Explain the concept of marketing strategies

C6BC14FE37424BAAA9CE661CF85B8259.description:
Demonstrate understanding
of the concepts and tactics
utilized to determine and
target marketing strategies
to a select audience

E7B9AE2A0FDA49CA9F475A3D284BE8EF.description:
Evaluate marketing research procedures and findings to assess their credibility
(e.g., identify sources of error in a research project, evaluate questionnaire design,
assess appropriateness of marketing research for the problem/issue)

100F53803096470DA2966168DBCC92FA.description:
Demonstrate understanding of data-collection methods to evaluate their
appropriateness for the research problem/issue (e.g., describe data-collection
methods [e.g., observations, mail, diaries, telephone, Internet, discussion groups,
interviews, scanners, tracking tools], explain characteristics of effective datacollection instruments). Demonstrate understanding of marketing-research
design considerations to evaluate their appropriateness for the research
problem/issue (e.g., describe methods used to design marketing research studies
[i.e., descriptive, exploratory, and causal], describe options businesses use to
obtain marketing research data [i.e., primary and secondary research], discuss
the nature of sampling plans [i.e., who, how many, how chosen])

9AA9E2E32F8A49D1B9825CA9C8C663FD.description:
Interpret marketing information to test hypotheses and/or to resolve issues
(e.g., explain techniques for processing marketing data, monitor/measure
customer “buzz,” explain the use of descriptive statistics in marketing
decision making)

EA21DE906C7045338831E73833D3C474.description: Explain the nature of marketing research and its problems/issues

CCAFD66752B34343BC1660B4065456BF.description:
Acquire foundational knowledge of marketing-information management to
understand its nature and scope (e.g., describe the need for marketing data,
identify data monitored for marketing decision making, explain the nature and
scope of the marketing-information management function, explain the role of
ethics in marketing-information management, describe the use of technology
in the marketing-information management function, describe the regulation
of marketing-information management)

39E6E6D9113E463D81E13774F7C58648.description:
Demonstrate understanding
of the concepts, systems,
and tools needed to
gather, access, synthesize,
evaluate, and disseminate
information for use in
making business decisions

A818700462DE423389756454F6D37A04.description:
Explain how to manage channel activities to minimize costs and to determine
distribution strategies (e.g., describe how to coordinate channel management
with other marketing activities, explain the nature of channel-member and
affinity partner relationships)

0EEA458F2B8041CDB16C4E2B11A29568.description:
Acquire foundational knowledge of channel management to understand its
role in marketing (e.g., explain the nature and scope of channel management,
explain the nature of channels of distribution, describe the use of technology
in the channel management function, explain legal considerations in channel
management, describe ethical considerations in channel management)

6CE86B64A5104B8B96D9FD3486CB0F26.description:
Demonstrate understanding
of the concepts and processes
needed to identify, select,
monitor, and evaluate
sales channels

C03757C925F646679BE02DB31172DB51.description:
Explain and apply quality assurances to enhance product/service offerings
(e.g., grades and standards, warranties and guarantees, consumer protection
provisions of appropriate agencies)

36639A6280444580ADA1C1C39946A404.description:
Demonstrate how to position company to acquire desired business image
(e.g., describe corporate branding and factors used by businesses to position
corporate brands, identify customer touch points)

A099EBECD6E14606828DA53E01CB6B41.description:
Position products/services to acquire desired business image (e.g., describe
factors used by marketers to position products/services, explain the nature of
product/service branding, describe the role of customer voice in branding)

DEBAAADFAF024016A0BC9E70907B1C2A.description:
Generate product ideas to contribute to ongoing business success
(e.g., identify product opportunities and ideas, implement techniques
to generate a product idea)

2437250D8D284C1480FADD52A17322D4.description: Explain product mix and product bundling

54FFBD145A75495F9392943E1FD42329.description:
Acquire a foundational knowledge of product/service management to
understand its nature and scope (e.g., explain the nature and scope of the
product/service management function, the management of product/service
profitability, the impact of product life cycles on marketing decisions, the use
of technology in the product/service management function, and/or business
ethics in product/service management)

DBABD2F8B3B74BA4BFB1FC3671935036.description:
Demonstrate understanding
of the concepts and processes
needed to obtain, develop,
maintain, and improve
a product or service mix
in response to market
opportunities and/or to build
brand for the organization

B2C9A49FBD654CCB9FA9875BD626B365.description: Explain the need for professional and ethical standards

5D16572B75F742129E69F1D3C21595A3.description:
Demonstrate understanding of responsibilities in marketing to demonstrate
ethical/legal behavior

E3FB67F128E14F88910510937A255CA9.description:
Demonstrate understanding
of concepts and strategies
used to explore, obtain, and
develop in a marketing career

DB5813C4E625468DB7B7F130EC5C83FC.description:
Identify the types of organizations that are engaged in marketing
(e.g., non-profits, small companies, corporations, financial services
providers, political groups)

6C0E87A86A2047DBB151A6A670F4CF55.description:
Describe how individuals from different disciplines collaborate to provide
marketing services (e.g., marketing, advertising, product management, public/
customer relations, customer service, media & entertainment, social media,
graphic design, finance, and accounting)

245FE69F27EC43A9866C33DB2479BB9E.description:
Describe the individuals and
organizations that collaborate
to provide marketing services
